intro: Secamone curtisii, commonly known as the African nightshade, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and peppers. The plant is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that are typically purple or violet in color. It produces small, toxic berries that are often used in traditional medicine. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
